originalText.text: Never have seen such rude, uncaring, cruel, judgemental nurses! This hospital has the worst nurses (maybe not all but allot) I've ever came in contact with! As a person with congested heart failure I will rather die at home then step foot in this hospital again!

originalText.text: The truth is that when an institution is made up of people who are really committed to the service and well-being of people, it shows! I filed a complaint with this platform which in less than 24 hours was taken into account and I am quite happy that it was so because it shows that they are people who are at the service of people and willing to improve and maintain the quality in their institution, very good work and I hope that it always stays that way, that they are one of the most prestigious places and with such good human quality, congratulations for your management definitely this hospital has the best manager and people in charge!!!!

originalText.text: Horrible treatment on 9/16 I came to this hospital waited 3 hours and more to be seen. On 9/17 I was seen in the ER the nurse was horrible. I was left with an empty IV drip for a while. She dismissed me when I was seeking some assistance. That nurse knew I was pregnant. She didn’t even bother to check in once in a while. I seen people wait 2 hours for discharge papers.

originalText.text:
I am a very patient person and I understand that a lot of decisions are left up in other peoples hands, but the LACK of care and UNPROFESSIONALISM at this ED feels CRIMINAL. There is a patient has been in the ED from Friday 1pm until Sunday afternoon. That is THREE day teams and TWO night teams that have passed. The patient has not been moved from the ED or assigned a bed in the main hospital. I have been on hold trying to contact someone from PPOC, NYP patient movement team for half an hour and not one person has picked up the phone. This patient is approaching 90years old, elderly. Keeping an ELDERLY patient in the ED for 30+ hours is UNSAFE for patient safety.

I spoke with the hospital administrator who basically DISMISSED my concern and told me she would pass it on to the same unit that I have been trying to contact and is CLOSED until Monday morning.

IF the problem is you have no beds, TRANSFER patients who are waiting on beds to hospital that does have beds.

NEW YORK PRESBYTERIAN SHOULD BE ASHAMED OF ITSELF AND THE WAY IT TREATS PATIENTS!
